If you're in the mood for a thought-provoking sci-fi film, I'd recommend giving "Eraserhead" (1977) a try. Directed by David Lynch, this surreal and intriguing movie follows Henry Spencer, a factory worker grappling with his industrial environment and an unconventional child.

Alternatively, if you're interested in a more action-packed sci-fi, "Star Wars: Episode III - Revenge of the Sith" (2005) might be just what you're looking for. This installment of the Star Wars saga delves into the dramatic transformation of Anakin Skywalker and his fateful encounter with Chancellor Palpatine, as the Clone Wars reach their climax. Enjoy the epic space battles, captivating characters, and a riveting plot twist!

Based on your interest in war stories with a deeper narrative, I'd highly recommend "The White Countess" (2005). This film is set in 1930s Shanghai and tells a captivating story about a blind American diplomat who forms an unusual relationship with a young Russian refugee. The star-studded cast, including Vanessa Redgrave and Natasha Richardson, adds to its allure.

Another intriguing option could be "Zulu" (2013), which focuses on the investigation of a brutal murder in South Africa, intertwined with the disappearance of black street children. This film stars Conrad Kemp, Tanya van Graan, and Orlando Bloom. Both these movies offer compelling narratives that might appeal to your preferences.
